title: Container test configuration
description: Schema for apps/*/container-test.yaml consumed by testhelpers.RunChecksFromYAML. Define one or more check groups (http, tcp, commands, filePaths) for a container image.

timeoutSeconds.description: Optional overall timeout for the full YAML check run in seconds. This wraps image pull/create, wait checks, file checks, and command checks. Values below 120 are accepted in YAML, but runtime enforces a 120-second minimum to avoid startup pull/create flakiness on larger images.

http.description: HTTP readiness checks. Each item waits for TCP listening on the same port first, then performs an HTTP request and validates status code.

tcp.description: TCP readiness checks. Each item waits for a TCP port to become reachable inside the started container.

commands.description: Command checks executed as `sh -c <command>`. Useful for validating binaries, versions, behavior, and optional output matching.

filePaths.description: File existence checks. Each string is verified with `test -f` inside the container.

items.description: Absolute file path expected to exist in the container filesystem.

httpTestConfig.title: HTTP test
httpTestConfig.description: Configuration for a single HTTP readiness check.

port.description: Container port number to probe (string form, e.g. "8123").

path.description: HTTP path requested on the port. Defaults to `/` when omitted.

tcpTestConfig.title: TCP test
tcpTestConfig.description: Configuration for a single TCP listening check.

port.description: Container port number to wait on (string form, e.g. "8000").

host.description: Reserved for compatibility with legacy configs. Runtime currently waits on container ports and does not use this field.

commandTestConfig.title: Command test
commandTestConfig.description: Configuration for a single command check executed as `sh -c <command>`.

command.description: Shell command to execute inside the container.

expectedExitCode.description: Expected command exit code. Runtime defaults to 0 when omitted.

expectedContent.description: Expected substring in command output (container logs). Used only when matchContent is true.

matchContent.description: Enable substring matching against command output. When true, expectedContent must be present in output.

nonEmptyString.description: String that must contain at least one character.
